Values / categories: Unique ID
Description / notes: Respondent identifier from raw file. Primary key for joins across your derived tables.

Values / categories: Continuous weight
Description / notes: Survey weight; use for all weighted estimates and city-level aggregation.

Values / categories: 26 named capitals + Brasília: São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Belo Horizonte, Brasília, Salvador, Recife, Fortaleza, Curitiba, Porto Alegre, Belém, Manaus, etc.
Description / notes: Capital name derived by recoding numeric Capital codes to labels (e.g., 100 → São Paulo, 500 → Rio de Janeiro, 4300 → Aracaju, etc.). This will be your join key to the capitals geometry after you standardize names on the GIS side.

Values / categories: Sudeste, Sul, Nordeste, Centro-Oeste, Norte
Description / notes: Macro-region classification recoded from numeric codes 1–5. Important for your regional comparison maps.
Age bands for population 16+. Use this whenever you stratify or report age results; also relevant if you ever normalize within age groups.

Values / categories: Elementary, Secondary, Higher Education
Description / notes: Collapsed education variable: 1 = Elementary, 2 = Secondary, 3 = Higher Education. This is your main education indicator for maps and analysis.

Values / categories: A, B1, B2, C1, C2, D/E
Description / notes: AB class system; recoded from numeric codes 1–6. This is the cleanest social class variable; you’ll normalize these by population 16+ at city level.

Income band derived from Rendaf codes 1–7, 9, 97, 99. Use for descriptive context and maybe cross-tabs, but for the main inequality maps, Socioeconomic_group is cleaner and less “don’t know/refused” noise.

Values / categories: White, Black, Mixed, Asian, Indigenous
Description / notes: Self-declared color/race. Recoded from numeric codes 1–5.

Values / categories: Married, Single, Widowed, Separated
Description / notes: Standard marital status groups, recoded from codes 1–4. Mostly contextual.

Values / categories: Man, Woman, Other responses
Description / notes: Composite gender identity. Logic: P54A: 1=Male, 2=Female, 3/4 look at P54B; P54B: 1=Male, 3=Female, 2/4/5/96/99 grouped as “Other responses”. You collapsed multiple non-binary/other codes into a single “Other responses” category.

Values / categories: LGBTQIAPN+, Heterosexual, Other
Description / notes: Recoding: several codes grouped to LGBTQIAPN+, 5 → Heterosexual, and specific residual codes mapped to Other. This is a simplified orientation axis, more for descriptive breakdowns than mapping.

Values / categories: Catholic, Evangelical, Spiritist | Kardecist, Afro-Brazilian, Atheist / No religion, Undefined, Other, NA
Description / notes: Heavily collapsed from many numeric codes into a small set of labels. Evangelical includes multiple sub-denominations; several codes go to Other or Undefined; 98 becomes NA (blank). This is useful as a high-level cultural context variable.

Values / categories: No children, Children
Description / notes: Derived indicator: if Nfilhos == 96 → No children; else Children

Values / categories: Always connected, Almost always connected, Sometimes connected, Never connected
Description / notes: Recoding: 1=Always, 2=Almost always, 3–4 both → Sometimes connected, 96=Never connected. This is your structural access proxy when interpreting digital vs physical cultural participation.

Raw field: P1A–P1S (excluding P1E, P1F, P1K, P1O, P1P)
Description / notes: Count of cultural activities the respondent reports doing in the last 12 months across 14 selected P1 items. For each kept item, response==1 (“Last 12 months”) is counted; other values (2=“More than 1 year ago”, 3=“Never”) are not counted.

Values / categories: Heavy user (14-8), Medium user (7-4), Low user (3-1), No user (0)
Did you go to libraries?
Description / notes: 1= Last 12 months, 2= More than 1 year ago, 3= Never

Values / categories: Did you go to the cinema?
Description / notes: Last 12 months, More than 1 year ago, Never

Values / categories: Did you go to the circus or attend circus performances?
Description / notes: Last 12 months, More than 1 year ago, Never

Values / categories: Did you go to museums or exhibitions of art or historical nature?
Description / notes: Last 12 months, More than 1 year ago, Never
dropped

Did you go to dance shows or dance performances?
Did you go to book fairs or literary festivals?
Did you go to music shows or musical performances?

Did you go to poetry, literary or musical gatherings, or poetry slams/battles?
Did you go to popular, traditional, or folk festivals?

Did you play electronic games on video game consoles, computers, cell phones, or tablets?
